definition: Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
surname Ding
(onom.) ting-a-ling (in compounds such as 玎玲 or 玲瓏|玲珑)/tinkling of gem-pendants

sentences.english: Ding Ling's novel creation in content shows the deep modern spirits.
sentences.chinese: 丁玲小说创作在思想内容方面表现出深刻的现代精神。

sentences.english: The structure of Safei′s Diary is radiating.
sentences.chinese: 丁玲的《莎菲女士的日记》的艺术结构是辐射式的。

sentences.english: Ding Ling is an authoress with a strong hope of self-renewal.
sentences.chinese: 丁玲是一位有着强烈自我更新愿望的女作家。

sentences.english: After 1955, Ding Ling was involved in the political campaign.
sentences.chinese: 1955年后，丁玲被卷入政治运动中，九死一生。

sentences.english: In the history of literature, Dingling has been a unique disputable being all the time.
sentences.chinese: 在文学史上，丁玲一直是一个独特的有争议的角色。

sentences.english: Ding Ling is special and meaningful in Chinese modern literature history.
sentences.chinese: 在现代文学史上，丁玲是个有意味的存在。

sentences.english: Ding Ling is a well-influential writer of Chinese modern novels.
sentences.chinese: 丁玲是有广泛影响的中国现代小说作家。

definition: Xia Yan (1900-1995), Chinese writer, playwright, socialist critic and movie pioneer
Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Zhang Tianyi (1906-1985), children's writer, author of prize-winning fairy tale Secret of the Magic Gourd 寶葫蘆的秘密|宝葫芦的秘密[Bao3 hu2 lu5 de5 Mi4 mi4]
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Deng Tuo (1912-1966), sociologist and journalist, died under persecution at the start of the Cultural Revolution/wrote under the pen name Ma Nancun 馬南邨|马南邨
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Agnes Smedley (1892-1950), US journalist and activist, reported on China, esp. the communist side
Xiao Hong (1911-1942), prominent woman writer, originally from Heilongjiang
Jiang Qing (1914-1991), Mao Zedong's fourth wife and leader of the Gang of Four
Ai Qing (1910-1996), Chinese poet

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Zhao Shuli (1906-1970), proletarian novelist
Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
variant of 蝴蝶[hu2 die2]
